title: FS: T206 Ty Cobb Red Background Lenox Back
author: Bigb13

posts.post_title: FS: T206 Ty Cobb Red Background Lenox Back
posts.post_content:
For sale T206 Red Background with a Lenox back. This card is very rare only 8-10 known.    Looking for 25k or best offer.                                                                [IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=261539&d=1486944020[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=261540&d=1486944061[/IMG]
Pm sent
delete
What is it any of your business. I can try to sell cards just like you. I never say a word about what you sell.
I take back the last comment, sorry..

No your not, there is always some people on here that are jealous and have to say something. The card is for sale to serious people only if your not serious please no comments unless you would like me to comment on your posts.
Don't push it Robert....
Don't push  me my friend you opened your mouth first now leave it alone. You sell your stuff and I will sell mine. Stay out of my business. I guess it's just jealousy that you don't own it.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1630261]Don't push  me my friend you opened your mouth first now leave it alone. You sell your stuff and I will sell mine. Stay out of my business.[/QUOTE]

Well, It look's like we are off and running! Thanks for taking the high road Robert... I'll start the bidding at $3500...
I promise never to post again in this thread.  :cool:
Mr Cobb is still available
Weekend Bump
Still Available Please only serious offers
I still have this beautiful card up for grabs.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1648107]I still have this beautiful card up for grabs.[/QUOTE]

This card ever sell?
Yes, it was sold in a private sale to a board member, Aaron Seefeldt.

[quote name="Sean" post=1630281]I promise never to post again in this thread.  :cool:[/QUOTE]

Hmmm.

posts.post_title: How much did it sell for?
posts.post_content:
Honestly, despite the great entertainment on th related thread,  i don’t think $17k or so would be too unreasonable.  The card is an investment grade item no doubt with great long term potential imo. 

So can the buyer or seller let the world know what it sold for or will that be kept private?

[quote name="uniship" post=1705533]Honestly, despite the great entertainment on th related thread,  i don’t think $17k or so would be too unreasonable.  The card is an investment grade item no doubt with great long term potential imo. 

So can the buyer or seller let the world know what it sold for or will that be kept private?[/QUOTE]

Its kept private...that way when the card is for sale again, the seller can say 'i have more into the card than your offer'   The asking price was 25k which is still posted on the first post...at least we know that

[quote name="Sean" post=1630281]I promise never to post again in this thread.  :cool:[/QUOTE]

And here's another broken promise: When the card was offered through Heritage (twice) it failed to reach the reserve of $15K. Aaron even mentioned this when he told us that he bought it. So I'm guessing that the purchase price was less than $15K.

[quote name="Sean" post=1705610]And here's another broken promise: When the card was offered through Heritage (twice) it failed to reach the reserve of $15K. Aaron even mentioned this when he told us that he bought it. So I'm guessing that the purchase price was less than $15K.[/QUOTE]

Watch it now.    Posting  Asking price is one thing to post especially when the seller posts it for all to see....but giving a lower amount in what it may of sold for is crossing a big line....   someone may start a thread about you giving potential sale prices..

[quote name="Sean" post=1705610]And here's another broken promise: When the card was offered through Heritage (twice) it failed to reach the reserve of $15K. Aaron even mentioned this when he told us that he bought it. So I'm guessing that the purchase price was less than $15K.[/QUOTE]

Watch it now.    Posting  Asking price is one thing to post especially when the seller posts it for all to see....but giving a lower amount in what it may of sold for is crossing a big line....   someone may start a thread about you giving potential sale prices..

I would be even more worried because you have now done that on less than 1% of the posts..
